tagline: Welcome To My Garden is a not-for-profit network of citizens offering free camping spots in their gardens to slow travellers.

membership-notice.answer: a WTMG membership for all slow travellers. Find out more {linkText}!

membership-expired-notice.prompt: Want to renew your WTMG membership{amount} now?
membership-expired-notice.answer: Then click {linkText}. Thank you for your support!

banner-stmf.copy: Want to prepare your slow travels with the community while supporting Welcome To My Garden? Check out our {stmfLink} (from 3 to 29 June)!

banner.copy: Welcome To My Garden now has its {title} with wooden WTMG signs and thank you postcards for hosts. Go check it out at {link}!
banner.title: online shop

banner.copy: Do you want to get started with slow travel? Good news! You can now take secret slow travel trips to discover the hidden side of Belgium. We just launched {title} - go check it out at {link}.
banner.title: Slowby

intro.headline: Your slow travel adventure starts here
intro.copy: Camping spots in people’s gardens for slow travellers. Brought to you by a warm-hearted community of citizens.

0.title: Step 1: Sign up to get started
0.copy: Sign up to find camping spots in people’s gardens and contact hosts, or {addGardenLink} to the map!

1.title: Step 2: Plan your journey
1.copy: Make arrangements with your host, and plan your hiking or cycling route to your host’s garden.

2.title: Step 3: Pitch your tent
2.copy: Meet your host, pitch your tent and enjoy your stay - whether that means a quiet night or hanging out with your host!

faq.title: All you need to know
faq.copy: Here are the most important things you need to know about your next adventure. Please read this FAQ section thoroughly so that you know what you’re getting yourself into. More questions? Read more in {faqLink}!

0.title: Who is Welcome To My Garden for?
0.copy: Welcome To My Garden has been created for hikers and cyclists who need a camping spot on their trail at the end of the day. It isn’t meant to replace fully-fledged campsites; just a safe spot for the night! Consider it an addition to Belgium’s network of bivouacking sites. Welcome To My Garden is non-commercial: no money should exchange hands. This means that as a host, you cannot ask your guests to pay for their stay.

1.title: How do I get to my camping spot?
1.copy: Welcome To My Garden is for slow travellers only. Please walk or bike to your camping spot. Of course you can use public transport or your car to get to the start of your trail - as long as you don't turn up at your host's in your car!

2.title: How do I request a stay?
2.copy: Except if clearly stated on the host’s profile, you should always contact the host in advance. When you request a stay, please provide some information about yourself, your arrival date and time.

3.title: What about facilities?
3.copy: Basically hosts just offer a corner in their garden for you to pitch your tent on. In addition, they may offer access to drinking water, a toilet and electricity. They are not obliged to do so though: all of these are bonuses. Consider a garden as a bivouac spot; not a fully-fledged campsite.

4.title: Does Welcome To My Garden cost anything?
4.copy: Staying at a WTMG host is free. Yet, to maintain and develop WTMG, we rely on a yearly membership to split costs fairly among all slow travellers. Memberships are not automatically renewed and are valid for a year. You can become a member here.

superfan.financial-support: With your financial support, WTMG can remain free for everyone to use! Will you help us make WTMG survive and thrive? Become a Superfan and get access to new features!
superfan.subtitle: New: a fair model for WTMG

0.name: Frank & Katlijn
0.quote: We love hearing the stories of slow travellers. Some just started, others travel with children. Everyone has a story.

1.name: Carolien and her family
1.quote: Apparently WTMG doesn’t only bring together people but also animals. We were kindly welcomed with our donkeys!

2.name: Marie Marth
2.quote: Thanks to WTMG and to the slow travellers I’ve been hosting, I’m rediscovering my own region on foot now. I see everything from a new perspective and it’s fascinating.

rules.title: Rules
rules.description: Here’s how Welcome To My Garden works. Make sure to read the rules before starting your adventure! After all, this platform will only work well if we all play by the rules.

0.title: Network of citizens
0.copy: Welcome To My Garden is a network of citizens offering free camping spots in their gardens to slow travellers. It is a not-for-profit initiative and no income should be made from it. Welcome To My Garden will not take any responsibility for any loss, damage or injury incurred during a stay.

1.title: Send a request in advance to the garden owner
1.copy: Garden owners might not be home and ready to welcome you at all times. We ask users to contact the garden owner in advance to check availability directly. This should be done by sending a request to the host through their profile. After establishing the initial connection you can exchange contact details, so that you can stay in touch and update your host about your arrival time by email or phone, depending on their preference. When you send a request, provide some information about yourself and about your expected arrival time. Offensive behaviours and misuse of the platform will lead to accounts suspension (please see our terms of use).

2.title: Only for slow travellers (no car rule)
2.copy: Welcome To My Garden respects the environment and has been set up for slow travellers only. This means you can only reach the camping spots on foot, by bicycle or public transport. Getting there with your private car is forbidden. You are allowed to drive to the start of your hiking or biking trail – as long as you don’t turn up at the camping spots in your car.

3.title: Maximum duration of stay
3.copy: You can stay at a camping spot for a maximum of 48 hours. Always check with the garden owner.

4.title: Maximum amount of tents
4.copy: Garden owners define how many tents they can accommodate each night (this is not Dour Festival). Please respect their choice.

5.title: Facilities
5.copy: Facilities may vary from one camping spot to another. Some garden owners might offer access to their bathrooms; others might prefer not to. Please respect their choices in these matters as well.

6.title: Respect for nature
6.copy: All your waste has to be taken away. This includes pee and poo if there’s no toilet available: find a bush or tree outside the garden for Number One; bag your Number Two and throw it in a bin the next day. Respect nature and the garden owners: apply the Leave No Trace principle as you would if bivouacking out in the wild.

7.title: No noise policy
7.copy: Please respect the camping spot owners’ privacy. So don’t sing along with Celine Dion at the top of your voice or generate any other type of noise – definitely not after 10pm!

8.title: Have fun!
8.copy: This is a great opportunity to meet other people and have fun! Learn a few words of your host's language if you’re travelling in a different region than your own. Be curious, share stories and build new friendships!

9.title: Spread the word
9.copy: Would you like to open up your garden or do you know someone who would be happy to? Spread the word about Welcome To My Garden! You can invite them to like our Facebook Page too.

what.title: What is Welcome To My Garden?
what.copy: Welcome to My Garden is a network of citizens opening up their gardens to slow travellers in need of a camping spot. It’s a not-for-profit initiative set up by a group of citizens during the first Covid-19 lockdown. Welcome To My Garden is now a social enterprise, on a mission to make slow travel more accessible for everyone.

who.title: Who is Welcome To My Garden for?
who.copy: Welcome To My Garden has been created for hikers and cyclists who need a camping spot on their trail at the end of the day. It isn’t meant to replace fully-fledged campsites; just a safe spot for the night! Consider it an addition to a network of bivouacking sites.

how.title: How does Welcome To My Garden work?
how.copy: People who want to open up their garden to travellers can add their garden by clicking “Add your garden”. People who want to stay in a garden have to become members and then contact the hosts to arrange their stay.

how-camping.title: How do I get to my camping spot?
how-camping.copy: Welcome To My Garden has been set up to meet the needs of slow travellers: hikers and cyclists who need a camping spot at the end of the day. For this reason you are supposed to arrive at your camping spot on foot or by bike, or by public transport – definitely not by car.

what-facilities.title: What facilities will you find in the garden?
what-facilities.copy: Basically hosts just offer a corner in their garden for you to pitch your tent on. In addition, they may offer access to drinking water, a toilet and electricity. They are not obliged to do so though: all of these are bonuses. Consider a garden as a bivouac spot; not a fully-fledged campsite. Features are displayed on the garden overview; you can also filter for features using the button next to the search bar.

cost.title: Does Welcome To My Garden cost anything?
cost.copy: Staying at a WTMG host is free. Yet, to maintain and develop WTMG, we rely on a yearly membership to split costs fairly among all slow travellers. Memberships are not automatically renewed and are valid for a year. You can become a member here.

no-garden.title: I don’t have a garden. Can I still travel to other people’s gardens?
no-garden.copy: Yes! You don’t need to offer a garden to use one. The platform is open to all slow travellers!

how-long.title: How long can I stay there?
how-long.copy: Since these gardens only cater to the needs of slow travellers who are on a multi-stage trek or bike ride, you can stay at a camping spot for a maximum of 48 hours (two nights). Of course you can move on to the next camping spot after that! And the next. And the next… Always check with the host how long you can stay, some hosts will prefer that you stay one night only.

animals.title: Can I bring my family? My children? My dog?
animals.copy: It’s best to ask your host whether they are open to children and/or dogs. Quite a few hosts have already indicated on their profile that they are open to families, but even if they haven’t, you can always ask!

no-toilet.title: So, what if there’s no toilet?
no-toilet.copy: Not every host may offer access to a toilet. In this case, please find a spot outside the garden that meets your needs. Pee behind a tree, and bag your Number Two so you can bin it the next day. Apply the Leave No Trace principle as you would when camping out in the wild.

tent-type.title: What type of tent can I bring?
tent-type.copy: Since WTMG is only catering to hikers and cyclists, we expect you to bring nothing bigger than a trekker’s tent. That means it should easily fit in your pack. If you’re not sure your tent will fit in your host’s garden, please consult them before leaving.

privacy.title: How does Welcome To My Garden guarantee my privacy as a host?
privacy.copy: All your personal details are protected by the login system. If you are a host, we will not display your house number or exact location on the map. You can give this to your guests once you’re in touch with them. You decide how you want them to contact you: by email, by phone, or both.

messaging.title: I’ve received a message from a slow traveler. Where should I answer it?
messaging.copy: The conversation between hosts and travelers takes place via the chat on the platform. If you receive a notification email that you received a message, go to {chatLink} to answer.

suspend.title: I would like to suspend my garden for a while but I will be back soon! How do I do this?
suspend.copy: Go to {accountLink}. In the 'Your garden' category, untick the box 'Shown on the map'. The garden will still be saved in the platform but won’t appear on the map. When you’re back, just tick the box again and you can start welcoming slow travellers again!

issue.title: I’ve had an issue with a guest or a host. How do I report it?
issue.copy: Any issue or misconduct should be reported to Welcome To My Garden by email: {support}. In case of misconduct we reserve the right to remove unilaterally this person’s account (see Terms of Use).

privacy.title: I just signed up but I haven’t received the confirmation email.
privacy.copy: Contact the support team (support@welcometomygarden.org) and they will help you verify your email!

messages.title: I have issues reading messages.
messages.copy: First, try to log in using a different browser such a Firefox or Google Chrome. If it doesn’t work, contact the support at support@welcometomygarden.org. There’s always a solution to everything, we’ll find it together!

update-email.title: I would like to update my email address or delete my account. How do I do this?
update-email.copy: If you’d like to change your email or delete your account, please go to your {accountLink}.

newsletter.title: I would love to receive your next newsletter! What should I do?
newsletter.copy: To receive our next newsletter, go to {accountLink} and tick the box “Welcome To My Garden has news to share”. If you’d like to stop receiving news, untick the same box.

text-in-english.title: There’s text in English, whereas it’s not my preferred language. How can I change this?
text-in-english.copy: On your computer, go to the bottom left and choose the language of your choice. On your phone, click on the burger menu. If some text isn’t translated to your preferred language yet, then it appears in English.

notifications.title: I still have a question about receiving mobile notifications.
notifications.copy: You can find everything you need to know about mobile notifications in {mobileFaqLink}.

fb-page.title: Why is the Facebook page only in English?
fb-page.copy: First of all, there is a very practical reason: English is the only language the entire team can communicate in fluently enough! We also want WTMG to be open to everyone, so that people in other countries can implement the initiative in their country too. On the Facebook page we will stick to English. If you feel more comfortable writing in Dutch or French please do!

privacy-policy.title: Privacy policy
privacy-policy.subtitle: Responsible for the processing of the Data and Owner
privacy-policy.intro: Welcome To My Garden, a not-for-profit project under the legal entity of Slowby, a social enterprise, incorporated and existing under the laws of Belgium, with registered office at Henri Van Bortonnestraat 100, 1090 Jette, Belgium, with company number BE 0784.423.261.

scope.title: Privacy Policy
scope.copy: This ‘Privacy Policy’ applies to the ‘Personal Data’ collected by Welcome To My Garden through this website.

meaning.title: What does personal data mean?
meaning.copy: In this Privacy Policy, Personal Data refers to information that makes it possible to identify you. An identifiable person is someone who can be identified, either directly or indirectly, in particular by referring to an identification number or to one or more factors that are linked to physical, physiological, mental, economic, cultural or social identity. A typical example of personal information is your name and email address.

collection.title: What personal data do we collect?
collection.copy: We might collect your Personal Data from the following sources:

0.title: Personal Data that you provide during the registration process on the platform.

1.title: Personal Data that we collect when you visit our website.

list.0: We use cookies to automatically collect personal data about you when you use this website. For more information, please consult our Cookie Policy.

2.title: Personal Data that you provide when adding your garden to your account.

list.0: Your garden's location (coordinates: the latitude and longitude) (mandatory)
list.1: Information about your garden (description, facilities, the amount of tents you can welcome) (mandatory)

list.0: In case you agree to share your location with Welcome To My Garden, the Welcome To My Garden map will be centered on the location provided by your browser. Welcome To My Garden does not store your location of any kind, not in a cookie nor in local storage. The user location only serves to improve your user experience by centering the map.

usage.title: How do we use personal data?
usage.subtitle: We might use your personal data for the following purposes

purposes.0: To create and maintain your user profile on this website;
purposes.1: To manage the identification and authentication of users;
purposes.2: To verify your user account in order to guarantee the necessary security measures;
purposes.3: To provide information about your garden to the community of users;
purposes.4: To alert you when updates are taking place on the platform;
purposes.5: To alert you when activities on the platform may interest you.

usage.copy: The personal data is only stored and processed for the period required for the purpose of the processing. After that, the data will be deleted or anonymized. Welcome To My Garden relies on Firebase which is certified under major privacy and security standards. Firebase services are GDPR compliant. All information related to Firebase can be found here.

backups.title: Back-ups
backups.copy: Welcome To My Garden makes a backup of all its data every 6 hours and stores the data for 30 days. If you request your account to be deleted, the data will be stored in backup for this duration. None of this data will ever be used unless there’s corruption of production data.

0.title: With whom do we share your personal data?
0.copy: Your personal data will not be shared with any third party. We will never sell or rent your personal data to other service providers, nor will we share your Personal Data with any service providers who are not compliant with the GDPR.

1.title: Where do we transfer your personal data to?
1.copy: We only transfer your Personal Data to service providers established outside the European Economic Area if they comply to art 44 GDPR. All US-based service providers comply with Privacy Shield.

2.title: Automated decision-making and profiling
2.copy: The processing of your personal data does not include profiling and will not be subjected to automated decision-making by Welcome To My Garden.

rights.title: What rights do you have?
rights.copy: You have the right to view your personal data at any time, as well as the right to be informed of the use that Welcome To My Garden makes of your personal data.

0.title: Right to rectification, removal and restriction of processing
0.copy: You are free to decide whether or not to provide your personal data to Welcome To My Garden. In addition, you always have the right to amend, supplement or remove your personal data at Welcome To My Garden. You acknowledge that a refusal to provide or a request for the removal of personal data means that certain services can no longer be delivered. You may also request the limitation of the processing of your personal data.

1.title: Right to object
1.copy: You have the right to object to the processing of your personal data, as long as this is for serious and legitimate reasons.

2.title: Right to data portability
2.copy: You have the right to obtain the personal data you have provided to Welcome To My Garden in a structured, typical and machine-readable form and/or transfer it to different controllers.

3.title: Right to withdraw consent
3.copy: Insofar as the processing is based on your prior consent, you have the right to withdraw this approval.

4.title: Right to lodge a complaint
4.copy: You have the right to lodge a complaint to the Belgian Privacy Commission: Personal Privacy Protection Commission, Drukpersstraat 35, 1000 Brussels, Belgium, Tel +32 (0)2 274 48 00, Fax +32 (0)2 274 48 35, email: commission@privacycommission.be. This does not affect relief before a civil court.

exercise-rights.title: Exercising your rights
exercise-rights.copy: You can exercise your rights by contacting Welcome To My Garden to this end by sending an email to {support}, provided you enclose a copy of your identity card

additional-info.title: Additional information on data collection and processing

0.title: Legal procedures

copy.0: The Processor and the Controller for the processing of the Data might use the Personal Data of the User for legal purposes, for the court or legal proceedings in the event of unlawful use of this Application or the related services.
copy.1: The User is aware that the Processor and the Data Controller might be obliged to disclose the personal data at the request of competent government institutions for the processing of the Data.

copy.0: Welcome To My Garden has developed security measures which have been adjusted at the technological and organisational level to prevent the destruction, loss, falsification, changing, prohibited access or the erroneous disclosure to third parties of personal data as well as any other prohibited processing of this data.
copy.1: Under no circumstances can Welcome To My Garden be held liable for any direct or indirect loss resulting from the incorrect or unlawful use of your personal data by a third party.
copy.2: You must at all times comply with the security instructions, which includes preventing all prohibited access to your login details including your password. You are solely responsible for the usage of the website on your computer, from your IP-address and with your identification details, as well as for keeping these confidential.

0.title: Personal data (or Data)
0.copy: All information regarding a natural person, a legal person, an institution or an association that has been or might be identified directly or indirectly by reference to other information.

1.title: Usage data
1.copy: Information that is automatically collected from this Application (or external services used in this Application), including: the IP addresses or domain names of the computers used by the Users of this Application, the URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) ​​addresses, the time of the request, the method used to submit the request to the server, the size of the file received in response to it, the numerical code indicating the status of the server response (successful, error, etc.), the functions of the browser and the operating system of the User, the different time data per visit (such as the time spent on each page of the application) and the data collected while using the application (example : the order of pages visited or other parameters about the operating system of the device).

2.title: User
2.copy: The person using this Application and who must agree with or be authorized by the Data Subject to whom the Personal Data refers.

3.title: The person concerned
3.copy: The legal person or natural person to whom the Personal Data relates.

4.title: Data processor (or Data supervisor)
4.copy: The natural person, legal entity, government administration or any other institution, association or organization that has been authorized by the Data Controller to process the Personal Data in accordance with this privacy policy.

5.title: Responsible for the processing of the data (or Owner)
5.copy: The natural person, legal person, government administration or any other institution, association or organization with the right, also jointly with the Controller for the processing of the Data to make decisions regarding the purposes and methods of processing Personal Data and the means used, including security measures regarding the exploitation and use of this Application. The Controller for the processing of the Data is the Owner of this Application, unless otherwise indicated.

6.title: This Application
6.copy: The hardware or software tools through which the Personal Data of the User are collected.

7.title: Cookie
7.copy: Small chunk of data stored on the User's device. See our Cookie policy.

legal-info.title: Legal information
legal-info.copy: Notice to European Users: this privacy statement has been drawn up with due observance of the obligations in art. 10 of the European Directive 95/46 / EC and the provisions of European Directive 2002/58 / EC, as well as the revision in Directive 2009/136 / EC regarding cookies.

change-warning.title: Changes to this privacy policy
change-warning.copy: The Controller for the processing of the Data reserves the right to change this privacy policy at any time by notifying Users on this page. We encourage you to check this page for possible changes. The date of the last change is indicated at the bottom of the page. If a User objects to any change in the policy, the User must not continue to use this Application. One might request the Controller for the processing of the Data to delete the Personal Data. Unless otherwise indicated, the valid Privacy Policy applicable at that time applies to all Personal Data that the Controller has stored for the processing of the Data about Users.

filter.title: Filter
filter.available: {styledAmount} {amount, plural, one {garden} other {gardens}} available with the active filters.

guest.login: You must {signInLink} and be a member to contact hosts
guest.become-member: To contact hosts, you should first {becomeMember}. Thank you!

drawer.phone-notice: Phone numbers are only visible to members.

form.title: Add your garden to the map
form.auth-notice: You must be signed in to add your garden to the map. Either {signInLink} or {registerLink}.
form.email-confirm-notice: You need to verify your email before you add your garden to the map. We sent you an email when you created your account. You can resend a verification link from {accountLink}.
form.normal-notice: By submitting this form, your garden will be added to the map. You can manage or remove it at any time from {accountLink}.

location.title: Location (required)
location.notice:
Move the marker to set the location of your garden. You can fill in the address fields to move the marker closer to you.
We don't store your address information.
location.coordinate-hint: Make sure you have dragged the map marker to the exact location of your garden, and have clicked "Confirm pin location"

description.title: Describe your camping spot (required)
description.notice:
A short description of your garden and the camping spot you can offer. This information is displayed publicly, so don't include any personal details here.
Your description must be between 20 and 300 characters.
description.label: Description

facilities.title: Facilities
facilities.notice: What kind of facilities do travellers have access to?

capacity.label: Capacity (required)
capacity.help: How many tents do you have space for (estimation)

photo.title: Photo
photo.notice:
Show people what your garden looks like.
Make sure that the picture only shows the camping spot and doesn't include your neighbour's home.

hints.wrong-format: Your photo must be a JPEG, PNG, or TIFF file.
hints.too-large: Your image is too large. An image's file size should be 5MB or smaller.

form.invalid: Some information was not valid. Please check your submitted information for errors.

notify.photo: It may take a minute for its photo to show up.

notify.incorrect: The provided email or password is incorrect.
notify.login-issue: We couldn't log you in. If the problem persists, please contact {support}

three-features.feature-two-description: upload your route, save gardens & see the rail network.

three-support-reasons.title: Thanks to your support, we can...
three-support-reasons.support-one-description: We are committed to keeping WTMG safe and user friendly. This requires hard work!
three-support-reasons.support-two-description: We’re moving beyond the volunteer stage: WTMG needs our full-time attention to stay alive and kicking!
three-support-reasons.support-three-description: We want to create a community space where people can meet and talk, both online and offline.

modal.subtitle: Slow travel with WTMG
modal.title: Become a Member!
modal.intro: Staying at a WTMG host is free. Yet, to maintain and develop WTMG, we rely on a yearly membership to split costs fairly among all slow travellers. Join us today!

pricing-section.title: Pick your membership level
pricing-section.description: Valid for one year. Does not renew automatically.

0.title: Free
0.description: You can explore the map, host slow travellers in your garden, and receive the WTMG newsletter.

checklist.0: See all the gardens and trails on the map

1.title: Member
1.description: You get full access to the WTMG platform and cover your part of the costs.

checklist.1: Plan your journey: upload your route, save gardens & see the rail network
checklist.3: Keep WTMG ad-free, fully independent and member-supported

2.title: Superfan 💚
2.description: You’re truly passionate about slow travel and want to support WTMG’s mission.
2.mobile-superfan-copy: Member benefits, plus you really believe in what we’re doing and want to support WTMG’s mission.

checklist.0: Show your support and help us improve WTMG
checklist.1: Help us grow the slow travel movement and get more gardens on the map

pricing-section.terms-label: I use WTMG only as a slow traveller (never by car) and agree with all {termsLink}.
pricing-section.already-member: You are already a {type}, thank you!

video-section.title: Join the community
video-section.description:
Welcome To My Garden is on a mission to make slow travel more accessible for everyone. Like any garden, WTMG needs nurturing in order to grow and stay healthy.

Staying at a WTMG host is free. Yet, to maintain and develop WTMG, we rely on a yearly membership to split costs fairly among all slow travellers. Join us today!

0.title: Send free stay requests to all 5.000+ WTMG hosts on the map

1.title: Make arrangements with hosts through the chat and get to meet amazing new people.

2.title: Use handy features: upload your route, save gardens, and see the rail network.

3.title: Access the WTMG Community where members can meet, share experiences and ask questions.

4.title: Cover your part of the costs: WTMG needs money in order to maintain a quality network.

5.title: Keep WTMG ad-free, fully independent and member-supported: without the continued support of our community we cannot exist!

6.title: Support the work of a dedicated team of four slow travel enthusiasts.

team-section.title: Meet the team
team-section.description: So, who’s behind WTMG? We’re a small team of four slow travel enthusiasts and we want to help others embark on their slow travel adventures too!

0.name: Lieven
0.quote: A great initiative that encourages solidarity and togetherness among slow travellers, combined with state-of-the-art technology? I’m fully on board!

1.name: Boris
1.quote: Starting to travel by bicycle crystallized what I wanted to become: free, minimalist, autonomous and active.

2.name: Marie Marth
2.quote: WTMG is not only fun, it’s about changing the world, changing the way we travel.

3.name: Benoit & Hélène
3.quote: I'm happy to be surrounded by such an amazing community of slow travellers who put their actions where their mouths are!

0.title: Why is WTMG launching a membership?
0.copy: Welcome To My Garden is on a mission to make slow travel more accessible for everyone. Like any garden, WTMG needs nurturing in order to grow and stay healthy. Staying at a WTMG host is free. Yet, to maintain and develop WTMG, we rely on a yearly membership to split costs fairly among all slow travellers. Read our full story here.

0.title: What does it mean to be a member or a Superfan?
0.copy:
To maintain and develop WTMG, we rely on a yearly membership to split costs fairly among all slow travellers.

When you become a member or a Superfan, you can:

  • Send free request to 5000+ gardens
  • Handy features to plan your journey: upload your route, save gardens, see the trail network
  • Access the online community space
  • Keep WTMG ad-free, fully independent and member-supported.

A membership is valid for one year. It does not renew automatically.

1.title: What’s the difference between being a member and a Superfan?
1.copy: While Superfans have access to the same perks as members, they are very important to WTMG as they allow us to improve WTMG, grow the slow travel movement and get more gardens on the map. If you’re truly passionate about slow travel and want to support WTMG’s mission, this is for you!

2.title: Why does WTMG need a yearly financial contribution from slow travellers?
2.copy:
Each month, we spend thousands of euros and hundreds of hours keeping WTMG going. This is our life and our job: we need to pay our incomes, our office, hosting costs, and more.

WTMG is a fully independent project that has been fully bootstrapped by its founding team; which means that no investors have been involved. To make sure that WTMG can exist in the years to come, a fair model means splitting the costs among slow travellers. Basically, if you use our platform we expect you to contribute.

3.title: Where will my money go?
3.copy:
Since we have nothing to hide and transparency matters, we have made an overview to give you insight into where the contributions of our members will go.

Annual membership fees will allow us to:

  • Maintain the WTMG platform and servers
  • Cover all operational costs like software costs, accountant and co-working space
  • Respond to support requests and questions from members and hosts
  • Maintain the quality of the WTMG network
  • Provide a community space where members can meet and share experiences
  • Improve the WTMG platform based on feedback from members
  • Communicate about WTMG externally and promote slow travel in general
  • Set up collaborations with other slow travel initiatives

4.title: How much do I need to contribute?
4.copy:
It’s up to you! You can either become a member or a Superfan, depending how much you believe in slow travel and how much you want to support us.

Becoming a member costs €36 per year, which basically covers your own cost. You can send free requests to 5000 gardens, get access to handy features to plan your journey and allow WTMG to stay ad-free, fully independent and member-supported.

Becoming a Superfan costs €60 per year. On top of getting all the perks as members, Superfans also help us improve WTMG, help us grow the slow travel movement and get more gardens on the map

Both memberships are valid for one year. It does not renew automatically.

5.title: How does payment work?
5.copy: Once you’ve chosen if you want to become a member or a Superfan, you will be redirected to the payment page. You pay for one year at a time. Becoming a member or Superfan is commitment-free: your subscription stops automatically after one year, and we’ll send you an email to renew it.

6.title: Is it mandatory to become a member or Superfan as a slow traveller?
6.copy:
Slow travellers need to make a yearly financial contribution so that WTMG can continue to exist. This is what we already asked for when we launched our call for Superfans. Now, we’re extending this request to our entire slow travel community. Basically, if you use our platform we expect you to contribute. This will be an annual contribution. So, in addition to the possibility of becoming a Superfan, we introduce a membership to extend our request for support from our first believers to the wider community.

We’re not asking hosts to chip in, since they are already contributing in a different way - but of course they are totally welcome to contribute financially too if they feel like it.

7.title: Didn’t you launch a call for Superfans already?
7.copy: At the end of 2022, we launched a call for WTMG Superfans. We’re very grateful for the support received from the first 250+ Superfans and a generous €1.000 donation from a host. Thanks to these first believers, we’re convinced that we can get to a self-sufficient model for WTMG. But to get there, we need wide support; not just from a small percentage of our users: we’ve calculated that we need the support from at least 3.000 travellers to make that magic happen.

8.title: If I don’t become a member or a Superfan, what will happen to my free account?
8.copy: As a free member, you can explore the map, host slow travellers in your garden, and receive the WTMG newsletter.

9.title: For how long will I become a member or Superfan?
9.copy: When you become a member or Superfan, you will pay for one year. Your subscription stops automatically after one year, and we’ll send you an email to renew it.

10.title: Can I stop being a member or Superfan?
10.copy: Yes! Our membership is valid for one year, and the payment is non-refundable. After one year, we will send you an invitation to renew for the next year. If you don’t wish to renew it, your membership will automatically stop.

11.title: Is a membership needed per person if I travel with friends or family?
11.copy: No, only one membership is needed to contact hosts when travelling with friends or family. However, each individual account is strictly personal, so anyone traveling separately would need their own membership.

0.title: I’m a host. Should I become a member or Superfan?
0.copy: First of all, we’re so happy that you’re welcoming slow travellers in your garden! WTMG wouldn’t exist without warm-hearted citizens like you. If you want to become a Superfan and support us on our mission to make slow travel more accessible, we’d be very happy about that. But we want to stress that you’re already making a huge contribution as a host!

0.title: Who’s behind WTMG?
0.copy: We’re a small team of four slow travel enthusiasts (Dries, Manon, Thor & Janneke) working full time on making WTMG possible. You can read more about us here.

1.title: What’s the legal structure behind WTMG?
1.copy: Welcome To My Garden, a not-for-profit project under the legal entity of Slowby, a social enterprise, meaning that we’re an initiative striving for social impact. The five principles of the Code Social Enterprises are our guideline for decision making. To safeguard the mission of WTMG, we're considering becoming a cooperative or implementing a steward ownership model at some point in the future. Yet, first we need to make sure that we can create a viable model that makes WTMG financially stable.

2.title: How much does it cost to run WTMG?
2.copy:
Each month, we spend thousands of euros and hundreds of hours keeping WTMG going. This is our life and our job: we need to pay our incomes, our office, hosting costs, and more.

WTMG is a fully independent project that has been fully bootstrapped by its founding team; which means that no investors have been involved. To make sure that WTMG can exist in the years to come, a fair model helps to split the costs among slow travellers.

3.title: How did the WTMG bills get paid so far?
3.copy:
Until now, the costs of WTMG have mainly been paid out of the pockets of our founding team.

This is how we’ve covered the costs so far:

  • The vast majority of the bills got paid thanks to the income made from planning trips with our side-business Slowby.travel (€30k), and the distribution rights of Manon’s documentary Women Don’t Cycle (€25k).
  • In its first year of existence, WTMG got some financial support from early believers like Grote Routepaden, GR Sentiers and Natuurpunt.
  • At the end of 2022, we launched a call for WTMG Superfans. We’re very grateful for the support received from the first 230+ Superfans and a generous €1.000 donation from a host. Thanks to these first believers, we’re convinced that we can get to a self-sufficient model for WTMG. But to get there, we need wide support; not just from a small percentage of our users: we’ve calculated that we need the support from 3.000 travellers to make that magic happen.

4.title: Have you tried other ways to generate income - like donations, sponsorships and subsidies?
4.copy:
We’ve already tried out a few ways to generate the income we need to keep going. The following have proven to be unsustainable for WTMG:

  • Donations. It’s tempting to think that we can make it work if everyone voluntarily contributes a little bit. In reality, it turned out that donations were insufficient to even cover all the technical costs. In total, we’ve received less than €500/year in donations.
  • Running another initiative (like we did with our Slowby trips). Since WTMG requires our full-time attention, it’s simply too big an effort to run two big initiatives at the same time with a team of three. Someone also correctly called this funding model a recipe for burnout (no worries, we’re still full of positive energy, but that’s why we need to act now).
  • Subsidies. They’re great to kick off a project, but don’t make it financially self-sufficient in the long run. As nicely explained in this post by Library of Things, applying for subsidies would also distract us from our real goal: creating value for our community.

We’ve chosen not to display ads on our website. Why? We don’t want to sell your data to companies whose values may not align with ours. But also, going after advertising would shift our focus away from creating value for users. We want to get paid for a great slow travel platform that is worth paying for.

So, to sum it up, we believe it’s fair as well as reasonable to ask for a financial contribution from our slow travellers.

5.title: How many members does WTMG need to survive and thrive?
5.copy: To maintain a quality network and to continue developing WTMG, we need 3.000 slow travellers to become a member. Together we can make this work - that is what it means to be a community.

top-section.title: Thank you for joining the WTMG community! 🌟
top-section.description: We are so happy that you are joining the ride! 💚
top-section.features:
You can now:

  • Send stay requests to 5000+ gardens
  • Plan your journey: upload your route, save gardens & see the rail network
  • Access the community space
top-section.outro: Thanks to you we can keep WTMG ad-free, fully independent and member-supported.

closing-section.text:
A huge thank you on behalf of the entire team!

Dries, Manon, Thor and Janneke

PS: Want to find out more about who we are? Read our story here!

top-section.title: Thank you for supporting WTMG! 💚
top-section.description:
You are helping us to accomplish our mission: to make slow travel more accessible for everyone, encourage sustainable travel and foster precious new connections between people.

A huge thank you on behalf of the entire team!

The WTMG team,
Dries, Manon, Thor & Janneke

meetups.description: Looking for your next slow travel adventure? Join us at the WTMG meetup near {location} on {date}! The idea is simple: we meet in a WTMG garden, share our excitement about slow travel and have a great time together. It’s free, but mandatory to register. See you there!

0.copy: Welcome To My Garden is a platform where citizens open their gardens so that slow travellers (which means non motorized travellers who are travelling by bicycle or by foot) can camp there for the night.

1.copy: Welcome To My Garden, a not-for-profit project under the legal entity of Slowby, a social enterprise, incorporated and existing under the laws of Belgium, with registered office at Henri Van Bortonnestraat 100, 1090 Jette, Belgium, with company number BE 0784.423.261.

2.copy: These Terms of Service ("Terms") apply to your access to and use of the website and the use of the network (collectively, our “Platform”) provided by Welcome To My Garden.

3.copy: The use of this platform is subject to a number of rules. Below you can find the general conditions of our platform, as we are convinced that clear rules provide the best guarantee for a respectful community. By creating an account or otherwise accessing the Platform, you agree to these Terms.

4.copy: Because Welcome To My Garden appreciates the feedback of the users of their platform, we welcome any ideas to further improve the platform. You can email your suggestions to {support}.

0.title: Who can register on the platform?

0.copy: Any citizen who wants to offer a free camping spot in their garden to slow travellers and any slow travellers - strictly defined as non-motorized travellers like cyclists and hikers - who want to use the network. If you want to add your garden, you need to create an account. If you want to contact a host as a slow traveller, you need to become a WTMG member. Only registered participants can be active users. You can register with your email address.

1.copy: The creation of an account by a user does not give this user ownership over the account. Welcome To My Garden reserves the right to refuse, suspend or delete accounts, for example if the user does not comply with the following rules or inappropriate behaviour has been reported by a host or guest.

0.title: Each account must comply with the following rules‍
Every account is strictly personal
0.copy: Each account must be unique and linked to a natural person. If you register for an account, you must provide accurate account information and promptly update this information if it changes. Every user has the right to create one account. If it is determined that one person has multiple accounts, Welcome To My Garden reserves the right to delete all these accounts. Every user must be over 18 years old.

1.title: An account cannot be transferred to another person
1.copy: Since each account is strictly linked to one specific person, this account cannot be transferred to another person without the permission of Welcome To My Garden. This transfer ban must be considered in the broadest sense. Welcome To My Garden reserves the right to refuse or delete this account in case of infringements.

2.title: An account cannot be used for commercial purposes
2.copy: The Welcome To My Garden platform is intended to enable citizens to offer their gardens as free camping spots and to enable slow travellers to use the network while travelling. An account can therefore only be used for these purposes. Any use of the account for the sole purpose of enjoying a commercial advantage is strictly prohibited.

3.title: The account information must always remain confidential
3.copy: It is not allowed for any other person than the actual person who created the account, to use this account. The person who created the account must ensure that (s)he keeps the password and login details safe. We strongly advise you to use a 'strong' password (a password with a combination of lowercase, uppercase letters and numbers). We advise you to use a password manager. Welcome To My Garden can under no circumstances be held responsible for any loss or damage incurred to the account if the above conditions are not met by the user. Welcome To My Garden cannot be held responsible for theft of your account, by 'phishing' for example, either. Welcome To My Garden will never ask its users for personal data such as a login or password via email. If personal data is requested, the user will always be redirected to the platform of Welcome To My Garden. You are responsible for all activities that occur in connection with your account and accept all risks of unauthorized access.

0.title: By adding your garden to the platform, you acknowledge the general rules of the platform which are as follows
No income
0.copy: Staying in garden is free. Therefore, no income should be made from it. Offering a garden against a fee is strictly prohibited and the platform reserves the right to delete a host’s account permanently if it happens.

1.title: Disclaimer
1.copy: The team behind Welcome To My Garden and Slowby will not take any responsibility for any loss, damage or injury incurred resulting from the use of the website and/or while staying in another citizen’s garden.

2.title: No discrimination
2.copy: Welcome To My Garden does not tolerate any kind of discrimination. Hosts are expected to act in compliance with this. Hosts cannot discriminate on the basis of gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, physical appearance, ability and religion (or lack thereof).

0.copy: Users must be at least 18 years old to use the platform. By creating an account, users immediately agree to the terms of use of Welcome To My Garden.

0.title: Contacting the hosts

copy.0: Hosts should solely be contacted to request a stay in their gardens. Any misuse of the platform may result in the suspension or deletion of the user’s account.

1.title: Obligation to contact hosts beforehand to request a stay

copy.0: Users are obliged to contact the host beforehand to request a stay, unless the host has clearly stated on their profile that this is not necessary. Users should always pass on accurate information about themselves.

The host is the sole responsible person for the facilities they do or do not put at the user’s disposal. By using this platform, the user acknowledges and accepts the conditions of their stay - which may or may not include access to sanitary facilities.
Users have to take all their waste away upon leaving. Users should always respect nature, the host’s garden and their surroundings, and adhere to the Leave No Trace principle.

4.title: Respect for the host and the neighbours

copy.0: Users should always be respectful of the garden owners and reduce noise to a minimum. They should also stick by any requirements the hosts have made.

The Welcome To My Garden platform respects the environment and caters to the needs of slow travellers only. This means users can only travel to gardens on f,,oot, by bicycle or by public transport. If you're planning to travel by motorized vehicle, please do not contact hosts via this platform. The use of motorized vehicles is forbidden.

6.title: Yearly membership: becoming a Member or Superfan

copy.0: Welcome To My Garden is on a mission to make slow travel more accessible for everyone. Like any garden, WTMG needs nurturing in order to grow and stay healthy. Staying at a WTMG host is free. Yet, to maintain and develop WTMG, we rely on a yearly membership to split costs fairly among all slow travellers. Slow travellers have the choice to either become Members or Superfans. This membership is mandatory. Members or Superfans are not allowed to transfer their login to a third party. Superfans agree with the same terms of all users and Welcome To My Garden reserves the right to refuse, suspend or delete accounts of Superfans who don’t comply with the terms.
copy.1: The limitations of liability (see below) of Welcome To My Garden in general also apply for the use of the extra features for Superfans, which means that Welcome To My Garden cannot be held responsible for any damages or loss that would occur due to the use of Welcome To My Garden.
copy.2: Slow travellers chose if they want to become Members (minimum contribution) or Superfans (extra contribution). The price includes 6% VAT applied to memberships. The subscription is commitment-free: it stops automatically after one year, and slow travellers get an email to renew it. The subscription is non-refundable and non-transferable to a third party.

copy.0: The team and volunteers behind Welcome To My Garden will not take any responsibility for any loss, damage or injury incurred as a result of using the website and/or while staying in another citizen’s garden.

0.title: You alone are responsible for your interactions with other users.

copy.0: Welcome To My Garden is a platform for users to put their garden freely at disposal, to request a garden stay and communicate with one another to achieve this use. Users have the sole responsibility for any interactions with other users of the platform. Welcome To My Garden has no involvement and no responsibilities or liabilities with respect to any communications or disputes between two users. To be very clear: Welcome To My Garden is a platform allowing hosts to put their garden freely at disposal, allowing users to use someone’s garden to camp and a place to communicate between users. Welcome To My Garden will not be and cannot be held responsible for the interactions or consequences of interactions between users. Users release Welcome To My Garden (and its team and volunteers) from claims, demands and damages (actual and consequential) of every kind and nature, known and unknown, suspected and unsuspected, disclosed and undisclosed, arising out of or in any way connected with such disputes. Always keep safety and good judgement in mind when using the platform.

Users are solely responsible for determining the identity and suitability of other users. As a host, you can always refuse users. As a traveller, you can decide where you want to stay. Welcome To My Garden cannot and do not confirm each user’s identity. The platform does not have any information about the user’s criminal background or morality. Always keep safety and good judgement in mind when using the platform.

4.title: Limitations to content and use of the platform

0.copy: To ensure that the Welcome To My Garden platform is working properly and that you can communicate and connect with others, there are some restrictions to the type of content that can be published via the platform. These are as follows:

0.title: Offensive behaviour

copy.0: We firmly believe in freedom of speech. However, in order to ensure that the platform can be used in a constructive way by all users, we do not allow offensive behaviour that constitutes harassment, intimidation or fear-mongering.
copy.1: Accounts and related accounts that are used to perform the actions listed below can be temporarily blocked and / or permanently deleted.
copy.2: Violent threats (direct or indirect): You may not threaten or promote violence. This includes the promotion of terrorism. Harassment: You may not incite to or be involved in deliberately insulting or harassing others. Here are some factors that we can take into account when assessing abusive behaviour: whether the main purpose of the reported account is harassing or sending offensive messages to others; whether the reported behaviour is unidirectional or contains threats; whether the reported account encourages others to intimidate another account; and whether the reported account sends intimidating messages to an account from multiple accounts. Hatred: You may not promote violence against other people or directly attack or threaten them on the basis of race, ethnic background, nationality, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, philosophical affiliation, religion, age, disability or illness. We also do not allow accounts whose main purpose is to incite others to do harm on the basis of these categories. Misuse of multiple accounts: Creating multiple accounts for overlapping use to avoid temporary or permanent suspension of an individual account is not allowed. Private data: You may not publish or post confidential data and private information of others without their express authorization and consent. These data include but are not limited to: credit card numbers, address details, telephone numbers or data that fall under the personal privacy of a person. Impersonation: You are not allowed to access the platform pretending to be someone else and specifically you may not deceive, confuse or threaten other users in this way. You may not be allowed to enter via the platform if someone else deceives, confuses or threatens in a manner that actually decks or threatens others.

copy.0: You shall defend, indemnify and hold harmless WelcomeToMyGarden.org (and each of its funders and/or volunteers) from any claim, demand, action, damage, loss, cost or expense, including without limitation reasonable attorneys’ fees, arising out or relating to (a) your use of our services; (b) any member content or submissions you provide; (c) your violation of these terms; (d) your violation of any rights of another; or (e) your conduct in connection with the services. Further, if you are using the services on behalf of any entity, you represent and warrant that such entity agrees to indemnify you and WelcomeToMyGarden.org for violations of these terms in accordance with this section. If you are obligated to indemnify us, we will have the right, in our sole and unfettered discretion, to control any action or proceeding and determine whether we wish to settle it, and if so, on what terms.

0.copy: Welcome To My Garden - including its team and volunteers - will not be liable to either users and/or hosts under any theory of liability—whether based in contract, tort, negligence, strict liability, warranty, or otherwise—for any indirect, consequential, exemplary, incidental, punitive or special damages. The platform cannot be held responsible for any failure or delay in performing the terms. The platform cannot be held responsible for any liability in case of personal injury or death resulting from using it.

1.copy: IN NO EVENT SHALL WELCOMETOMYGARDEN.ORG OR ITS FUNDERS AND VOLUNTEERS, INDIRECT OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, OR ANY OTHER DAMAGES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO LOSS OF USE, LOSS OF PROFITS OR LOSS OF DATA, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE, EVEN IF WE HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES, ARISING FROM OR RELATING TO: (A) THE USE OR INABILITY TO USE OUR SERVICES; (B) THE COST OF REPLACEMENT OF ANY GOODS, SERVICES OR INFORMATION PURCHASED OR OBTAINED AS A RESULT OF ANY INFORMATION OBTAINED FROM OR TRANSACTIONS ENTERED INTO THROUGH OR FROM OUR SERVICES; (C) DISCLOSURE OF, UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO OR ALTERATION OF YOUR CONTENT; (D) DAMAGES FOR LOSS OR CORRUPTION OF DATA OR PROGRAMS, SERVICE INTERRUPTIONS OR PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE SERVICES, EVEN IF WE KNOW OR HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES; (E) STATEMENTS, CONDUCT OR OMISSIONS OF ANY SERVICE PROVIDERS OR OTHER THIRD PARTY ON OUR SERVICES; (F) YOUR OR ANYONE ELSE’S CONDUCT OR ACTS IN CONNECTION WITH THE USE OF THE SERVICES, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION, BODILY INJURY, EMOTIONAL DISTRESS, DEATH OR ANY OTHER DAMAGES RESULTING FROM COMMUNICATIONS OR MEETINGS WITH OTHER REGISTERED MEMBERS OF OUR SERVICES OR PERSONS INTRODUCED TO YOU BY OUR SERVICES, WHETHER ON-LINE OR OFF-LINE; OR (G) ANY OTHER MATTER ARISING FROM, RELATING TO OR CONNECTED WITH OUR SERVICES OR THESE TERMS.

0.copy: We strive at all times to protect the Welcome To My Garden platform user from technical abuse and spam. Accounts that are used to perform the actions listed below can be temporarily blocked or permanently deleted.

1.copy: Malware / phishing / viruses / worms / Trojans: You may not post malicious content or links to such content for the purpose of damaging or disrupting someone else's browsers or computers, or of violating someone's privacy. Spam: You are not allowed to use the Welcome To My Garden platform to spam people.

0.copy: The use of the account may not in any way infringe applicable laws. This includes infringements against privacy legislation, intellectual property rights, the criminal code, etc.

1.copy: The account may not be used to promote illegal activities in any way.

8.title: In case of breaches of the aforementioned rules

0.copy: Welcome To My Garden reserves the right to delete the relevant messages if it detects infringements of the aforementioned rules, and may even suspend or permanently delete user accounts.

1.copy: Welcome To My Garden cannot be held liable in any way for messages posted by users or third parties, which violate the rules specified above. If a user detects an infringement, please report this to the following email address: {support}

2.copy: It may occur that harmful files can be downloaded via the platform, whether or not due to a user, or that users place harmful hyperlinks. Every download by a user or click on a hyperlink, placed by a user, is done at the user’s own risk. Any damage incurred is completely and solely the responsibility of this user.

0.copy: Welcome To My Garden respects the intellectual property rights of others and expects that users of this platform also respect these rights. Welcome To My Garden reserves the right to remove content that infringes intellectual property rights. Repeated infringements of intellectual property rights of any kind by a user will result in the suspension or removal of the account by Welcome To My Garden.

1.copy: Infringements against intellectual property rights can be reported via the following email address: {support}

10.title: Property rights Welcome To My Garden

0.copy: The source code of Welcome To My Garden is open source. You agree to be bound by and comply with any license agreement that applies to this open source software. The visual identity, including the logo and colors, and the name cannot be used nor replicated for any other platform without the prior permission of Welcome To My Garden.

We may make changes to these Terms from time to time. If we make changes, we will post the amended Terms to our Platform and update the 'Last Updated' date above. We may also attempt to notify you by sending an email notification to the address associated with your account or give notice through our Platform. Unless specified otherwise in our notice, the amended Terms will be effective immediately and your continued access to and use of our Platform after we give notice will confirm your acceptance of the changes. In any case, changes to these Terms will not be retroactive. If you do not agree to the amended Terms, you must stop accessing and using our Platform.

stmf.title: Slow Travel Mini Festival
stmf.description: Prepare your slow travels with the community

rv.ask: Registrations for the Velotour Festival 2025 are now open - we hope to see you there! 🎉🚴

about-us.who-behind: So, who’s behind WTMG? We’re a small team of four slow travel enthusiasts and we want to help others embark on their slow travel adventures too! Fun fact: all of us are both WTMG hosts and travellers.
about-us.dries: Dries is the one who came up with WTMG. He bought his first tour bike when he was only 18, and biked from Brussels to Tokyo with Manon in 2019. His love for open data and open source led him to work for Open Knowledge Belgium for a few years, which is also where he met Thor. He's leading the WTMG team and his enthusiasm is utterly contagious!
about-us.manon: Manon is a true multipotentialite and has a solution for everything. She ran a marathon twice, cycled from Brussels to Tokyo with Dries, and made a beautiful film about it: ‘Women Don’t Cycle’. She's the only one on the team who studied tourism. The fact that she's fluent in four languages and feels very comfortable in front of a camera makes her our unofficial spokesperson!
about-us.thor: Thor is the genius technologist any project needs. He participated in Open Summer of Code twice, where he met Dries in 2017. In the same year, he cycled from Leuven to Helsinki. He is now a WTMG host there! Not only is he a fantastic developer, he’s a great designer as well. He loves cooking, coding and reading long intriguing articles!
about-us.ward: Ward contributed to WTMG from the beginning!
about-us.janneke: Janneke loves words and is absolutely amazing with them. As soon as she read about WTMG, she immediately suggested there should be a Facebook page and has been taking care of our communication ever since! She is head over heels in love with Romania; she wrote a guidebook about it, bought a house there, and founded Roamaniac.
about-us.michiel: The original coder. Without him, WTMG wouldn’t exist.
about-us.marie: The genius designer. She made WTMG so pretty.
about-us.ismaila: Ismaila is the brain behind the filters on the map.
about-us.brent: Brent coded our first landing page.
about-us.ways-support: Here are all the ways in which you can support us.
about-us.our-story-description:
Hey! We’re Dries and Manon and we’re the proud parents of Welcome To My Garden. In 2019, we cycled from Brussels to Tokyo. Over the course of 11 months, we travelled through 21 countries, and were hosted by countless incredible people along the way.

When we arrived back in Belgium, we asked ourselves: how can we make slow travel easier and more fun in our own country? On a rainy Sunday afternoon in 2020, Dries set up the first version of WTMG. Within two hours, there were 50 gardens on the map - and after two weeks, there were 500!

We’ve come a long way since then: today, WTMG counts 30.000+ users and 4000+ gardens. It’s clear we’re here to stay! And it’s time to step up. We’ve listened to you, our community, and we’re now investing in making WTMG meet all your slow travel needs.

WTMG exists thanks to the hard work of a passionate bunch of volunteers, who invested evenings and weekends in it. But to keep going, we need more time and people power. This is why Thor and Janneke also jumped on board. We’re giving it our all, and are hoping that you will join us on the ride!
about-us.bigger-picture-description:
If there’s one thing we’ve learned over the past few years, it’s this: it’s time to slow down. This applies to life in general, but also definitely to travel specifically. The faster we travel, the more we miss out on. Fast travel generates a lot of CO2 emissions, disconnects people from their surroundings, and damages communities. Enter slow travel!

And enter WTMG! We are proud to be part of the solution to this global challenge. In two years’ time, WTMG has achieved a lot:

  • 31.000 users have embarked on a slow travel adventure
  • 4.300 warm-hearted hosts have opened up their garden to slow travellers
  • 57.000 stay requests have been sent through the WTMG platform
  • We started in Belgium but more and more gardens are now also popping up across Europe and beyond?
  • We received financial support from partners like Wikimedia Belgium, Grote Routepaden vzw, GR Sentiers and Natuurpunt

The most meaningful and memorable experiences happen when we take our time to explore and engage with our surroundings. With WTMG, we want to help you do just that. Together, we can make the world a better place – by travelling more slowly and more sustainably. Will you join the ride?

We’re always open to new ideas and collaborations, so please don’t hesitate to get in touch!
about-us.amazing-people: Last but not least, we want to thank these amazing people
about-us.cradle: Without these amazing people, Welcome To My Garden wouldn’t exist. They stood at the cradle of the platform and believed in it from the start!

partners-section.title: Early believers
partners-section.description: These partners helped us get going and believed in Welcome To My Garden right from the start!

prompt.title: Get a mobile notification for new chat messages.
prompt.garden-intro: You will automatically receive an email for each new request to stay in your garden
prompt.garden-follow-up: , and you can also get mobile notifications.
prompt.garden-enable: Would you also like to receive mobile notifications for new chat messages?
prompt.garden-ios-home: To turn on just add the WTMG website to your home screen in a few easy steps.
prompt.ios-installed: Never miss a message by turning on mobile notifications!
prompt.follow-up-desktop: Would you like to receive mobile notifications for new chat messages?

how-to.title: How to turn on mobile notifications

ios-upgrade.copy: To receive mobile notifications, {link} or higher, then go to your {accountSettings} to turn them on.

ios-browser-steps.1: Add WTMG to your Home Screen.
ios-browser-steps.2: Open WTMG from your Home Screen
ios-browser-steps.1-chrome:
• Click on {shareIcon} “Share” (top right)
  • Click on {plusSquareIcon} “Add to your Home Screen”
ios-browser-steps.1-safari:
• Click on {shareIcon} “Share” below
  • Click on {plusSquareIcon} “Add to your Home Screen”
ios-browser-steps.1-firefox:
• Click on the {burgerIcon} small icon menu below (not the WTMG menu)
  • Click on {shareIcon} “Share”
  • Click on {plusSquareIcon}“Add to your Home Screen”

error.permission-denied: Your browser is currently blocking mobile notifications for WTMG. To turn on notifications, update or reset your browser permissions. Simply follow the {faqLink}. It only takes two minutes!
error.generic: Something went wrong when turning on your mobile notifications. Can you refresh this page and then try turning them on again? If this doesn't work, please send the information below to {emailLink} so we can help you further. Thanks!
